p: Influenza A probably evolves under a negative pressure for CpG oligonucleotides. This is considered to happen due to innate immune recognition, something that is not so vital for influenza B evolution ( 42, 43). Additionally, it has been shown that antigenic drifts are more frequent to influenza A viruses than influenza B viruses ( 44). Even though antigenic drifts are usually gradual changes regarding the viral properties, the possibility for a rapid evolutionary change due to a mutation (punctuated evolution) cannot be excluded.
